page.title: 10Community Amenities
page.content:
{Aston}on Deeside in Clwyd is typical of many areas in Wales. A large housing program after the war provided council homes for families, but as children grew up parents were left living in a valuable family home.
A survey conducted by the local authority showed sheltered housing for older residents would be accepted. These homes have been built in several phases on land owned by Clwyd County Council. There are now over 90 homes and a community centre.Community amenities provied for the older & newer housing include a library ,council run nursery, social services community centre, home for the mentally handicapped, Greencroft and our school St. Ethelwold's Church In Wales Primary School.
